definition: to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: The paper deals with the convegence of Riesz operators for Jacobi expansions.
sentences.chinese: 討論了雅可比展開的黎斯算子的若干逼近性質。

sentences.english: The enemy troops were closing in upon the city from three different directions.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍正從三個不同方向逼近該市。

sentences.english: Then adaptive NNs (Neural Networks) are introduced for their structure and approximation ability.
sentences.chinese: 接着對自適應神經網絡及其逼近特性加以介紹。

sentences.english: Under error control the electrode non-uniform compensated surface was approximated.
sentences.chinese: 在控制誤差下，逼近補償後的非均勻電板曲面。

sentences.english: Duration October, yang Dezhi leads a ministry to approach Xu Shui, carry out to Xu Shui surround.
sentences.chinese: 時值十月，楊德志率部逼近徐水，對徐水實施包圍。

sentences.english: Circular interpolation of time-sharing algorithm is that circular arc is approached with tangent or chord line.
sentences.chinese: 時間分割法圓弧插補用切線或絃線來逼近圓弧。

sentences.english: The milestone date was quickly approaching, but teams were falling behind.
sentences.chinese: 要求的日期不斷逼近，但是團隊還落後於進程。

sentences.english: The little ship tried to escape when the big pirate ship bore down on it.
sentences.chinese: 那條大海盜船逐漸逼近時，小船力圖擺脫。
是的，他們正在逼近我們。

sentences.english: The summer season is upon us and with it comes bathing suit season.
sentences.chinese: 夏季正在逼近，隨之而來的也是泳衣季節。

sentences.english: In this paper, a successive approximation procedure for calculating eigenvalues of the complex characteristic equation is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了對復變特徵方程求根的一種系統逼近程序。

sentences.english: As the mist was closing in we decided to stay where we were.
sentences.chinese: 由於霧越來越逼近，我們決定留在原地不動。

sentences.english: Danger looming, Mao Buddha who has discovered the whereabouts of Smith.
sentences.chinese: 危險在步步逼近，茅迦人已經發現了史密斯的行蹤。

sentences.english: The British and American armies approached the Siegfried Line in September 1944.
sentences.chinese: 英美軍隊在1944年9月逼近齊格菲防線。

sentences.english: As the enemy advance continued, whole families would take to the bush.
sentences.chinese: 隨着敵軍逼近，家家戶戶都將逃入叢林。

sentences.english: As he moved threateningly forward she shrank from him.
sentences.chinese: 當他威嚇着逼近時，她躲開了他。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
(military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
